page.title: 05Shepreth education
page.content: At the moment there are 11 under five year old children at the playgroup. They do painting, drawing, glueing, listen to music, play in the sand pit and paddling pool, listen to stories and learn rhymes. They do one outing per term, sports day, picnics, or they go swimming. They do all sorts of Christmas fairs, fetes and sponsored events, and organise a fireworks party and summer fete for the village. They raise funds by events and collecting unwanted newspapers. The village primary school was closed in 1983 and the 25 children go by bus to Barrington. Others go to Meldreth and Cambridge. Secondary education is at Melbourn Village College.
